titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 578
CWG12133

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, December 30th, 1863.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 578.}
(Extract.)

23. At the request of the Governor of Kentucky, Private Joseph K. Pitts, 16th Kentucky Volunteers, is hereby honorably discharged the service of the United States, to enable him to accept a commission in another regiment.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townssend
Assistant Adjutant General.

K
16 Infy
Private Pitts
Discharged
Filed Jany 7 1864
